column4: newb question... is there an easy way to upgrade Hardy release to have Apache 2.2.9 versus 2.2.8?
you'll need to backport 2.2.9 from intrepid
as i said. backport
I dunno enough to just backport...  :)
do you know how to add repositories?
nope... willing to learn.  I figured out two upgrades with issues over ssh... so I should be able to do that
i have a better idea, prevu should be able to help you.
will look at that... thx!
why would I want to use prevu over going down the adding repositories path?
it's not advisable adding the intrepid binary repos to a hardy install - a mixed system like this could severly break things and you might not have ABI on hardy with a package built for intrepid
that works
Y/N:   You can have APT use the packages built by prevu by adding this to /etc/apt/sources.list
is that something you are asking me?  or is that some message you are encountering?
it was a question prevu is asking Y/N to
hmm, i'm not sure - i would say no to this if this is the only package from intrepid that needs backporting
if I understand the question... it is allowing apt to use a local repo versus a remote
i'd say it was local though i can't say for sure just from that one line.
deb file:/var/cache/prevu/hardy-debs ./ is the one below it
yea, it's a local repo then
so a Y would be ok then... going for it :)
ok :)
worked through a couple dependency issues and got the system running apache 2.2.9.  Cool part is that the site was down for about 1s :)
so thank you very much for the help!  now the question will be... does the problem go away
I guess you'll have to find out .. fingers crossed :)
